intro: Phacelia popei var. arizonica, commonly known as Arizona phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, which helps reduce water loss. It plays an important role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
